result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan William Vadnais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF: Ryan William Vadnais appeared from jail. Case called at 4:00. ADA Minser updates the Court. Atty. Stormont agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to 15CF525 removing the repeater. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CF525 removing the repeater. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
- 1 year St. Croix County Jail to be served concurrently
- Court notes 142 days credit. 
- Costs to be paid during DE ES status
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Bond is revoked, DE is remanded.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Stormont believes there is a resolution, requests a plea and sentencing. No request for PSI.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont DF:  Ryan William Vadnais appeared from jail. Case called at 9:09. Court reviews file. Competency evaluation has been completed. Court questions DE on the evaluation. Atty. Stormont waives an evidentiary hearing. Court questions DE about waiver. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly gives up his right to an evidentiary hearing. Court accepts waiver. Court finds DE is competent to proceed. Bond continues in form and amount. Court evaluation should be sealed in the court file.  Arraignment scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Donald J. Schwab DF ATTY: Alex Stormont. DF: Jaime Marie Tchida did not appear. DF Ryan Vadnais appeared in custody. Case called at 9:36. Includes 15CF524, 15CF525. ADA Hartung requests a Warrant for Ms. Tchida 15CF524. Court issues a Warrant. Atty. Stormont raises competency issues. Court questions Atty. Stormont. Court finds probable cause. Court authorizes an examination of the DE indicate the personal observations to the court completed by 12-18-2015. Bond continues in form and amount.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
filed by Liesl Nelson appointing Atty Alex Stormont. eif
Signed by SRN on 11/7/15.
Preliminary hearing at 11-18-2016 09:30 am

* Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J. Tchida.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Ryan William Vadnais appeared, via VCON. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
